bugphyzz

Source: vignettes/bugphyzz.Rmd
bugphyzz.Rmd

Introduction

The bugphyzz package provides access to an electronic resource of harmonized microbial annotations from different sources. The resource can also be accessed by direct download at >>> insert Zenodo link here <<<.

Import bugphyzz 

if (!require("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))
    install.packages("BiocManager")

## Devel version
BiocManager::install("waldronlab/bugphyzz")
library(bugphyzz)
library(dplyr)
library(purrr)
bp <- importBugphyzz(version = 'devel', force_download = FALSE)
#> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'httr':
#>   method           from  
#>   print.cache_info hoardr
#> Using data downloaded on 2023-06-05 20:23:29.
head(bp)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 12
#>   NCBI_ID Taxon_name         Rank  Attribute Attribute_source Evidence Frequency
#>   <chr>   <chr>              <chr> <chr>     <chr>            <chr>    <chr>    
#> 1 105825  Butyrate-producin… spec… acetate_… Barcenilla_2000  exp      usually  
#> 2 105826  Butyrate-producin… spec… acetate_… Barcenilla_2000  exp      usually  
#> 3 105829  Butyrate-producin… spec… acetate_… Barcenilla_2000  exp      usually  
#> 4 105830  Butyrate-producin… spec… acetate_… Barcenilla_2000  exp      usually  
#> 5 105831  Butyrate-producin… spec… acetate_… Barcenilla_2000  exp      usually  
#> 6 105832  Butyrate-producin… spec… acetate_… Barcenilla_2000  exp      usually  
#> # ℹ 5 more variables: Attribute_type <chr>, Attribute_group <chr>,
#> #   Confidence_in_curation <chr>, Score <dbl>, Attribute_value <lgl>

Explore wich attribute groups are available 

unique(bp$Attribute_group)
#> [1] "acetate producing"  "aerophilicity"      "arrangement"       
#> [4] "biofilm forming"    "gram stain"         "shape"             
#> [7] "growth temperature" "optimal ph"         "width"

Explore which attribute signatures are available 

head(unique(bp$Attribute))
#> [1] "acetate_producing:acetate_producing"  
#> [2] "aerophilicity:aerobic"                
#> [3] "aerophilicity:anaerobic"              
#> [4] "aerophilicity:facultatively_anaerobic"
#> [5] "aerophilicity:aerotolerant"           
#> [6] "arrangement:single"

Creating signatures

Create signatures of taxids at the species level for aerophilicity 

aer <- bp[which(bp$Attribute_group == 'aerophilicity'),]
sigs1 <- getBugphyzzSignatures(
  df = aer, tax.id.type = 'NCBI_ID', tax.level = 'species', min.size = 10
)
map(sigs1, head)
#> $`aerophilicity:aerobic`
#> [1] "1000562" "1001240" "100177"  "1002"    "1002227" "100225" 
#> 
#> $`aerophilicity:aerotolerant`
#> [1] "1454184" "1506"    "1656"    "1806172" "2798940" "2848170"
#> 
#> $`aerophilicity:anaerobic`
#> [1] "1000568" "1000569" "100133"  "100174"  "1002795" "1004583"
#> 
#> $`aerophilicity:facultatively_anaerobic`
#> [1] "1017095" "102684"  "1028752" "1031538" "1034471" "1036133"

Create signatures of taxa names at the genus level for growth temperature 

gt <- bp[bp$Attribute_group == 'growth temperature', ]
sigs2 <- getBugphyzzSignatures(
  df = gt, tax.id.type = 'Taxon_name', tax.level = 'genus', min.size = 10
)
map(sigs2, head)
#> $`growth_temperature:hyperthermophile`
#> [1] "Archaeoglobus"              "Ferroglobus"               
#> [3] "Geoglobus"                  "Candidatus Methanoliparum" 
#> [5] "Candidatus Methanolliviera" "Methanothermobacter"       
#> 
#> $`growth_temperature:mesophile`
#> [1] "Candidatus Poseidonia"      "Candidatus Thalassarchaeum"
#> [3] "Candidatus Haladaptoplasma" "Candidatus Haloplasma"     
#> [5] NA                           "Candidatus Saliniplasma"   
#> 
#> $`growth_temperature:psychrophile`
#> [1] "Natronobiforma"     "Methanogenium"      "Methanococcoides"  
#> [4] "Acidicapsa"         "Acidisarcina"       "Alloacidobacterium"
#> 
#> $`growth_temperature:thermophile`
#> [1] "Candidatus Baldrarchaeum"  "Candidatus Borrarchaeum"  
#> [3] "Candidatus Hermodarchaeum" "Candidatus Hodarchaeum"   
#> [5] NA                          "Candidatus Sifarchaeum"

Numeric attributes

Some attributes can be obtained with predefined labels or with numeric values. An example is growth temperature, which we obtained as categorical labels above (hyperthermophile, thermophile, psychrophile, mesophile). Let’s get the numeric values:

gt_num <- importBugphyzzNumeric(version = 'devel', force_download = FALSE)[[1]]
#> Using data downloaded on 2023-06-05 20:24:01.
df <- gt_num[gt_num$Attribute_value_min > 0 & gt_num$Attribute_value_max < 25,]
sigs3 <- getBugphyzzSignatures(
  df = gt_num, tax.id.type = 'NCBI_ID', tax.level = 'species'
)[[1]]
head(sigs3)
#> [1] "100"     "100053"  "1000562" "1001"    "1001240" "100133"
